newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - March 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - March 7.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Fidel Ramos says he will reliquish his position next year (PHILIPPINE DAILY INQUIRER)

- Chief presidential legal counsel Renato Cayetano challenges former first lady Imelda Marcos to produce the letter where President Fidel Ramos allegedly promised her to allow a hero's burial for her husband, former strongman Ferdinand Marcos (PHILIPPINE STAR)
- The Commission on Elections is set to deliberate on the validity of the signatures gathered by a group wanting to change the Constitution (MANILA BULLETIN)
- The Central Bank's gross international reserves reached a new high of $12.05 billion as of March 5, bank governor Gabriel Singson says.
- Some 32 local banks have been caught in the web of financial woes of sugar refiner Victorias Milling Co which incurred up to 6.6 billion pesos in debt (BUSINESSWORLD)

- The Board of Investments has attracted some $5 billion worth of investments from Hong Kong-based firms as a result of the strategy launched early last year to lure investors from Hong Kong (BUSINESS DAILY)
- The three oil firms led by dominant player Petron Corp are set to bring down the prices of most petroleum products, sources say.
